meanings.definition: To express disapproval or annoyance by making a clicking sound with the tongue.
meanings.sent1: Mom tsktsks when I forget to do my chores.
meanings.sent2: She tsktsks softly when the dog misbehaves.
meanings.sent3: The cat tsktsks at the messy room, demanding it be cleaned.
meanings.sent4: The teacher tsktsks like a metronome, keeping the class in line.
meanings.sent5: The old man's tsktsks echoed through the quiet room, a sign of his disapproval.

meanings.definition: The sound made by clicking the tongue to express disapproval or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: I heard a quick tsktsks from the other room.
meanings.sent2: The tsktsks of disapproval filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The toddler imitated the tsktsks of the adults, thinking it was funny.
meanings.sent4: The tsktsks of the clock seemed to mock his tardiness.
meanings.sent5: The tsktsks of the audience signaled their dissatisfaction with the performance.
